alert.note: Alert for DeWitt (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 06 at 8:55PM CDT until April 10 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Sandies Creek Near Westhoff affecting DeWitt County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Sandies Creek Near Westhoff. * WHEN...From Friday morning to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.5 feet, Major lowland flooding from the headwaters southeast of Seguin to the Guadalupe River confluence near Cuero is generally three quarters of a mile wide. Livestock are cut off and potentially drowned in the flood plain. Flow is to the bottom of the Westhoff/Cheapside bridge deck and four to five feet deep in the approaches. All secondary roads and bridge crossings over Sandies Creek are flooded and impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 25.2 feet Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.9 feet on 06/05/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Sandies Creek Westhoff 21.0 9.5 Thu 8 pm CDT 24.7 24.6 20.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1000 AM CDT.
